original_prompt:
We have the following blog content... what is the likely user intent of a searcher who lands on this page? Our goal should be to answer that intent better and faster than anyone else!

The content:

Consumers want more choices, but all those choices can be daunting. It gives the consumer the responsibility of educating themselves on the best option for their circumstances. On GigSalad, we deliver more than 600 categories of entertainment and event services for the ability to compare rates of various performers. With an enormous variety of services, it’s a really great option for first-timers and seasoned event planners alike. But with so many talented professionals out there, how do you choose? Budget may be a large factor in who you choose to book, but before you make your choice, here are 6 reasons for choosing the best entertainment, not the cheapest.

1. You get what you pay for.
Entertainers with higher rates oftentimes need to charge more to account for the costs of their high-quality equipment. Many performers set them based on their professional experience. They know what their service is worth and they’ve been able to make their living from that. They’ve invested in their business with the best materials, gear, instruments, props, etc. to give their clients most immersive experience. These materials can make a huge difference between one vendor and another.

Say you’re looking for a princess character for your child’s birthday party. To make a fairy tale come to life, performers need costumes and accessories that not only look pretty and authentic but also hold up to wear and tear. Along with the costs of dry cleaning, well-made costumes are a large investment for professional princess characters. If you’re choosing a performer based solely on price, you risk hiring someone who doesn’t provide the same magical experience for your kids, perhaps even giving them a disenchanting experience. A top-notch entertainer will deliver a performance that you and your family will remember for years to come.

 


 

Don’t let the sticker shock of good entertainment throw off your plans. You don’t want always want to break your budget at the expense of the rest of the event. Simply determine your priorities and set the spending from there. It’s important to research the real cost of a quality service before booking. If there is a significant drop-off between bids, then you can probably expect a drop-off in quality as well. Adjust your budget to your talent and quality expectations.

2. Professionals who are invested in their business are also invested in their clients.
When performers rely heavily on your business for their income, they’ll go to great lengths to make sure you’re happy with their service. Most of our GigSalad entertainers are self-employed, independent business people. They depend on good reviews and word of mouth for promotion and buzz.

Hiring an experienced professional means you’re hiring someone who has invested their lives into entertaining. Their goal is to make a living and provide you with a memorable event at the same time. Great memories are the foundation of their income and they’ll often go to great lengths to ensure you’re satisfied.

3. Pros know how to customize for your needs.
Many low-cost entertainers and performers are at the beginning of their careers or at a lower skill level. Often, this means that they offer a limited repertoire and fewer options as they are developing their craft. Your event is unique to you, therefore, you’ll need someone who can customize their act or services to your event. A good sign of a professional is their ability and willingness to reasonably adapt to your event needs.

4. Pros offer more than just entertainment. They give you peace of mind.
Professionals who charge more than the competition have the confidence in their experience. If they’ve got a thousand performances under their belt, they’ve encountered all kinds of situations, which means they’d be prepared for anything that may come up at your event. The ability to adapt and improvise is especially beneficial in unexpected situations that put your event at risk of turning into a disaster!


5. The difference in cost makes all the difference in the success of your event.
You’ve decided to take the risk and hire an entertainer for your event. Perhaps a strolling magician for the office party you were picked to plan. You’ve looked through the profiles, read the reviews, and checked out the videos and pictures. When the moment of decision comes, the temptation of saving a few bucks by hiring someone with fewer reviews and a lower quality presentation get very real very quickly. That’s money that could go to streamers! But those few dollars could mean the difference in the quality of your event and the likelihood of using entertainment again. A great professional turns the groans of “Remember last year? I hope that doesn’t happen again,” to the excitement of “Remember last year? I can’t wait to see what happens this time!” Paying a few extra bucks can prevent the dreaded buyer’s remorse.

6. There are no do-overs.
GigSalad’s mission is to help you Book Something Awesome. We recognize that many of the events we connect entertainers with are often once in a lifetime moments. That significance is one of the reasons we encourage you to take the time and research your providers well. You may not get a chance to do it again. We hope that you would take the few extra minutes necessary to thoroughly read the bids, examine the profiles, view the media, and make an educated decision. Don’t risk devaluing a critical life moment or celebration by going bargain hunting. If the price is right and the quality is high, invest in the memory.  

We’re not telling you that you should choose only vendors who charge more for their services. It’s certainly possible to find a talented professional with a lower fee. We’re simply encouraging you to do your homework. Look at their photos and videos, read reviews, ask them questions. Figure out why their rates are what they are. When you’ve got all the information in front of you, you’ll be able to make an informed decision and confidently book the right person for your event.

original_prompt: how o sort element using merge sort technique using array in java Save & SubmitCancel
instruction: how o sort element using merge sort technique using array in java Save & SubmitCancel
fine_tuned_response: I need a Java function implementation for the merge sort algorithm. The function should accept an integer array as input and return the sorted array. The implementation should be well-commented, explaining each step of the merge sort process. Also, provide a simple example in the main method demonstrating how to use the function to sort an array. The function signature should be: `public static int[] mergeSort(int[] arr)`. The example array to sort is: `{38, 27, 43, 3, 9, 82, 10}`. Save the code as MergeSort.java.

original_prompt: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element. One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
context: One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
instruction: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element.
fine_tuned_response:
You are a JavaScript expert. Your task is to implement a `GraphicLayer` class in JavaScript that manages the display and positioning of an image within a parent HTML element. The class should handle image loading, resizing, and centering. Provide a complete, runnable code example with clear comments.

Here's how the class should behave:

*   **Constructor:**
    *   Takes three arguments: `parent` (an HTML element), `image` (an HTML image element or a URL string), and `properties` (an object with the following optional properties: `centerPoint` {x: number, y: number} and `size` {width: number, height: number}).
    *   If `image` is a URL, it creates an image element and sets its `src`.
    *   Initializes the image's `top`, `left`, `width`, and `height` to 0.
    *   If the image is already loaded, calls a method `adjustImagePosition` to update the image's position based on the provided `properties`.
    *   If the image is not loaded, sets up an `onload` function that calls `adjustImagePosition` when the image finishes loading.
    *   Appends the image element to the parent element.
*   **`adjustImagePosition()` method:**
    *   Calculates the image's `top`, `left`, `width`, and `height` based on the parent element's dimensions, the `centerPoint` and `size` properties.
    *   Uses `style.top`, `style.left`, `style.width`, and `style.height` to update the image element's styles.
    *   Handles cases where the parent element doesn't have dimensions yet (e.g., on initial load).
    *   Sets the image's `visibility` to 'visible' after adjusting the position if it was initially hidden.
*   **Properties:**
    *   `centerPoint`: An object with `x` and `y` properties (both numbers between 0 and 1), representing the center of the image relative to the parent element. Default is `{x: 0.5, y: 0.5}` (center).
    *   `size`: An object with `width` and `height` properties (both numbers between 0 and 1), representing the dimensions of the image relative to the parent element. Default is `{width: 1, height: 1}` (100% width and height).

Include comments to explain each step of the code. Provide a complete, self-contained example.

original_prompt: Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logs
instruction: Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logs
fine_tuned_response:
You are an expert software architect. I need you to design an automated chat bot that will:

1.  **Integrate with multiple social media platforms:** Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, WhatsApp.
2.  **Analyze incoming text messages:** Determine the intent of the message (question, request, instruction, etc.).
3.  **Generate appropriate responses using GPT-3:** Maintain a consistent tone and persona based on user profile data.
4.  **Personalize responses:** Use user profile information (name, location, interests) to tailor the responses.
5.  **Handle complex conversations:** Maintain context and memory of previous messages.
6.  **Offer multiple response options:** Provide the user with a choice of pre-defined responses.
7.  **Learn from user feedback:** Improve its responses based on user ratings.

Provide a detailed plan, including:

*   **System architecture:** Explain the different components and how they interact.
*   **Data flow:** Describe how data moves through the system.
*   **Key technologies:** List the technologies you would use (e.g., specific NLP libraries, cloud services).
*   **Scalability considerations:** How would you design the system to handle a large number of users?
*   **Security considerations:** How would you protect user data and ensure the system is secure?

The output should be a well-organized document suitable for presentation to a technical team. Please focus on clarity, detail, and technical accuracy.

original_prompt:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
instruction:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
fine_tuned_response:
I need you to act as a technical documentation expert. I'm preparing to launch SWR 2.0, and I need a tweet to announce the release. Please provide a tweet that highlights the top 5 key new features in an engaging and informative way. Structure the tweet as a markdown list, using '◆' as the bullet point. Here are a few examples to guide you:

Example 1:
Tweet:

🚀 Announcing SWR 2.0! 🚀

◆ New Mutations API for easier data fetching and caching!
◆ Improved error handling with `onError` and `onSuccess` callbacks!
◆ Enhanced TypeScript support with better type inference!
◆ Revamped documentation with clear and concise examples!
◆ Performance improvements for faster page loads!

#SWR #react #datafetching

Example 2:
Tweet:

SWR 2.0 is here! ✨

◆ Simplified data fetching with the `useSWRMutation` hook!
◆ Enhanced caching mechanisms for faster data retrieval!
◆ Improved developer experience with better error messages!
◆ Expanded TypeScript support with comprehensive type definitions!
◆ New documentation with interactive code snippets!

#reactjs #datamanagement #swr2

I need you to act as a marketing expert specializing in event services. Analyze the following blog post:

"Consumers want more choices, but all those choices can be daunting. It gives the consumer the responsibility of educating themselves on the best option for their circumstances. On GigSalad, we deliver more than 600 categories of entertainment and event services for the ability to compare rates of various performers. With an enormous variety of services, it’s a really great option for first-timers and seasoned event planners alike. But with so many talented professionals out there, how do you choose? Budget may be a large factor in who you choose to book, but before you make your choice, here are 6 reasons for choosing the best entertainment, not the cheapest.

1. You get what you pay for.
Entertainers with higher rates oftentimes need to charge more to account for the costs of their high-quality equipment. Many performers set them based on their professional experience. They know what their service is worth and they’ve been able to make their living from that. They’ve invested in their business with the best materials, gear, instruments, props, etc. to give their clients most immersive experience. These materials can make a huge difference between one vendor and another.

Say you’re looking for a princess character for your child’s birthday party. To make a fairy tale come to life, performers need costumes and accessories that not only look pretty and authentic but also hold up to wear and tear. Along with the costs of dry cleaning, well-made costumes are a large investment for professional princess characters. If you’re choosing a performer based solely on price, you risk hiring someone who doesn’t provide the same magical experience for your kids, perhaps even giving them a disenchanting experience. A top-notch entertainer will deliver a performance that you and your family will remember for years to come.

Don’t let the sticker shock of good entertainment throw off your plans. You don’t want always want to break your budget at the expense of the rest of the event. Simply determine your priorities and set the spending from there. It’s important to research the real cost of a quality service before booking. If there is a significant drop-off between bids, then you can probably expect a drop-off in quality as well. Adjust your budget to your talent and quality expectations.

2. Professionals who are invested in their business are also invested in their clients.
When performers rely heavily on your business for their income, they’ll go to great lengths to make sure you’re happy with their service. Most of our GigSalad entertainers are self-employed, independent business people. They depend on good reviews and word of mouth for promotion and buzz.

Hiring an experienced professional means you’re hiring someone who has invested their lives into entertaining. Their goal is to make a living and provide you with a memorable event at the same time. Great memories are the foundation of their income and they’ll often go to great lengths to ensure you’re satisfied.

3. Pros know how to customize for your needs.
Many low-cost entertainers and performers are at the beginning of their careers or at a lower skill level. Often, this means that they offer a limited repertoire and fewer options as they are developing their craft. Your event is unique to you, therefore, you’ll need someone who can customize their act or services to your event. A good sign of a professional is their ability and willingness to reasonably adapt to your event needs.

4. Pros offer more than just entertainment. They give you peace of mind.
Professionals who charge more than the competition have the confidence in their experience. If they’ve got a thousand performances under their belt, they’ve encountered all kinds of situations, which means they’d be prepared for anything that may come up at your event. The ability to adapt and improvise is especially beneficial in unexpected situations that put your event at risk of turning into a disaster!

5. The difference in cost makes all the difference in the success of your event.
You’ve decided to take the risk and hire an entertainer for your event. Perhaps a strolling magician for the office party you were picked to plan. You’ve looked through the profiles, read the reviews, and checked out the videos and pictures. When the moment of decision comes, the temptation of saving a few bucks by hiring someone with fewer reviews and a lower quality presentation get very real very quickly. That’s money that could go to streamers! But those few dollars could mean the difference in the quality of your event and the likelihood of using entertainment again. A great professional turns the groans of “Remember last year? I hope that doesn’t happen again,” to the excitement of “Remember last year? I can’t wait to see what happens this time!” Paying a few extra bucks can prevent the dreaded buyer’s remorse.

6. There are no do-overs.
GigSalad’s mission is to help you Book Something Awesome. We recognize that many of the events we connect entertainers with are often once in a lifetime moments. That significance is one of the reasons we encourage you to take the time and research your providers well. You may not get a chance to do it again. We hope that you would take the few extra minutes necessary to thoroughly read the bids, examine the profiles, view the media, and make an educated decision. Don’t risk devaluing a critical life moment or celebration by going bargain hunting. If the price is right and the quality is high, invest in the memory.

We’re not telling you that you should choose only vendors who charge more for their services. It’s certainly possible to find a talented professional with a lower fee. We’re simply encouraging you to do your homework. Look at their photos and videos, read reviews, ask them questions. Figure out why their rates are what they are. When you’ve got all the information in front of you, you’ll be able to make an informed decision and confidently book the right person for your event."

Identify the potential user intent behind this blog post. Then, for EACH intent, provide a concise statement of the intent, followed by a sample search query the user might enter to satisfy that intent.

fine_tuned_response: You are an expert computer scientist specializing in algorithms. Your task is to write a Java program that implements the merge sort algorithm to sort an array of integers. The program should be well-commented, easy to understand, and include a main method that demonstrates the algorithm's usage with a sample array. The code should be optimized for clarity and efficiency. Provide the complete, runnable Java code.

original_prompt: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element. One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.

(x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.

original_prompt: !Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logsThis content may violate our content policy. If you believe this to be in error, please submit your feedback — your input will aid our research in this area.
context: This content may violate our content policy. If you believe this to be in error, please submit your feedback — your input will aid our research in this area.
instruction: !Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logs
fine_tuned_response: I want to build an automated chatbot that can integrate with a user's existing social media accounts (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, Twitter) to automatically reply to direct messages and comments. To achieve this, I need a detailed, step-by-step plan. First, describe the necessary steps for setting up the integration with each platform, including any API requirements or authentication processes. Second, outline the process for training the chatbot on the user's past conversation logs to personalize its responses and mimic the user's communication style. Provide specific examples of how to handle different types of user requests (e.g., answering questions, providing information, performing tasks). Finally, discuss potential challenges and how to overcome them, such as handling ambiguous requests, maintaining context across multiple interactions, and ensuring the chatbot provides accurate and relevant information. The response should be structured in a clear and organized manner, suitable for someone with basic programming knowledge. Provide code snippets where appropriate to illustrate the steps involved.

original_prompt:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
instruction:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
fine_tuned_response: Let's think step by step. First, identify the key features of SWR 2.0 from the documentation. Second, analyze each feature to understand its benefits and how it improves upon the previous version. Finally, craft a tweet that summarizes the top 5 most impactful features in a concise and engaging manner, using markdown bullet points to list them. Focus on clarity and highlighting the value proposition of each feature.

original_prompt: I have a complex task for you
instruction: I have a complex task for you
fine_tuned_response:
You are a technical product manager with 10 years of experience. You are responsible for leading the development of a new AI-powered customer support chatbot for our e-commerce platform. The chatbot should be able to answer common customer questions about order status, shipping costs, return policies, and product features. Provide a detailed product requirement document (PRD) for this chatbot, including the following sections:

1.  **Goals and Objectives:** Clearly state the goals and objectives of the chatbot. What problems are you trying to solve? How will success be measured?
2.  **Target Audience:** Who is the target audience for this chatbot? Describe their demographics, needs, and pain points.
3.  **Key Features:** List the key features of the chatbot, including natural language understanding (NLU), natural language generation (NLG), and integration with our existing CRM system.
4.  **User Interface (UI) Design:** Briefly describe the UI design for the chatbot, including the layout, color scheme, and branding.
5.  **Technical Requirements:** Specify the technical requirements for the chatbot, including the programming languages, frameworks, and cloud platform that will be used.
6.  **Timeline:** Create a timeline for the development of the chatbot, including key milestones and deadlines.
7.  **Risk Assessment:** Identify potential risks that could impact the development or deployment of the chatbot and propose mitigation strategies.

Your response should be comprehensive, detailed, and technically sound. It should also be written in a clear and concise manner, avoiding jargon and technical terms where possible.

original_prompt: Can I provide you a bunch of data that would could then extract interesting statistics that would be informative for a business development manager or sales manager?
instruction: Can I provide you a bunch of data that would could then extract interesting statistics that would be informative for a business development manager or sales manager?
fine_tuned_response:
I have a large dataset containing customer purchase history. The data includes customer ID, product ID, purchase date, purchase price, and quantity purchased. I want you to write Python code using pandas to analyze this data. Provide a complete, runnable script that calculates the following statistics:

1.  Total revenue for each product.
2.  Total quantity sold for each product.
3.  Top 3 customers who spent the most in total.
4.  Average purchase price per product.

The script should output a pandas DataFrame for each statistic, with appropriate column headers. Provide clear comments within the code to explain each step. Assume the input data is in a CSV file named 'purchase_data.csv' with the columns mentioned above. Include error handling to ensure the file exists and can be read. Finally, provide example output for each statistic.

original_prompt: Please devise a multi-step plan for Fenerbahçe to become more successful than Galatasaray in football
instruction: Please devise a multi-step plan for Fenerbahçe to become more successful than Galatasaray in football
fine_tuned_response:
You are a seasoned football analyst with deep knowledge of Turkish football. Your task is to outline a comprehensive, multi-step plan for Fenerbahçe to surpass Galatasaray in terms of on-field success, financial stability, and overall brand reputation. The plan should be detailed, actionable, and realistic, covering the following aspects:

1.  **On-field Strategy:**  Detail specific tactics, formations, and player roles that would give Fenerbahçe a competitive advantage over Galatasaray. Include specific player recommendations (existing or potential acquisitions) for each position.
2.  **Youth Academy Development:**  Describe a plan to strengthen Fenerbahçe's youth academy, including scouting strategies, training methodologies, and pathways for young players to break into the first team. Include examples of successful youth academy graduates.
3.  **Recruitment and Transfer Policy:**  Outline a recruitment strategy that prioritizes value-for-money signings, data-driven player identification, and a clear transfer policy that balances short-term gains with long-term sustainability.
4.  **Financial Management:**  Develop a financial plan to ensure Fenerbahçe's long-term financial stability, including revenue generation strategies, cost-cutting measures, and debt management strategies. Include specific financial targets and metrics.
5.  **Marketing and Fan Engagement:**  Create a marketing plan to increase Fenerbahçe's fan base, enhance brand awareness, and generate more revenue through merchandising and ticket sales. Include specific marketing campaigns and initiatives.

Provide a detailed step-by-step plan, outlining the key actions required for each step. The plan should be approximately 500-700 words in length and presented in a clear and organized manner.

original_prompt: dot language graph process diagram for vehicle purchase back out from the perspective of a used car dealer, also include any shared steps for acquisitions
instruction: dot language graph process diagram for vehicle purchase back out from the perspective of a used car dealer, also include any shared steps for acquisitions
fine_tuned_response:
I want you to create a dot language representation of a process diagram outlining the steps involved in a used car purchase. Here's how I want you to structure it:

*   **Nodes:** Each node represents a key step in the process. Include nodes for:
    *   Customer Interest
    *   Vehicle Selection
    *   Test Drive
    *   Negotiation
    *   Financing Application (if applicable)
    *   Inspection
    *   Paperwork
    *   Purchase Completion
    *   Customer Satisfaction

*   **Edges:** Connect the nodes with directed edges, indicating the flow of the process. Show the sequence of steps.

*   **Attributes:** Add attributes to nodes and edges for clarity:
    *   **Node Label:** Use concise and descriptive labels for each node.
    *   **Edge Label:** Label edges to indicate the action or transition between steps (e.g., "Discuss Features," "Approve Financing," "Sign Agreement").

*   **Shared Steps:** Identify and visually represent any steps that are common between the used car dealer's perspective and the customer's perspective (e.g., "Test Drive," "Negotiation"). You can use different node colors or styles to highlight these shared steps.

*   **Layout:** Aim for a clear and organized layout that is easy to understand.

Provide the complete dot language code for the process diagram.

original_prompt: can you be my friend?
instruction: can you be my friend?
fine_tuned_response:
You are a helpful assistant tasked with creating prompts. Take the following prompt as an example, then create an improved prompt for the original task:

Original Task: Write a poem about nature.

Improved Task: Write a sonnet about a forest, using iambic pentameter. Include imagery of trees, sunlight, and wildlife. The poem should evoke a sense of peace and tranquility.

original_prompt: 1 / 1Are you familiar with the benefits of using an office furniture dealership to design an office space?
instruction: 1 / 1Are you familiar with the benefits of using an office furniture dealership to design an office space?
fine_tuned_response:
Here are a few examples to guide you.

      Example 1:
      Input: 1 / 1Can you explain the advantages of working with a local interior design firm for a residential project?
      Output: The advantages include personalized service, better understanding of local codes and regulations, and the ability to see the project come to life step-by-step. You can also build a long-term relationship with the designer.

      Example 2:
      Input: 1 / 1What are the key considerations when choosing an enterprise resource planning (ERP) system for a manufacturing company?
      Output: Key considerations include system functionality, cost of implementation and maintenance, ease of integration with existing systems, scalability to accommodate future growth, and vendor reputation.

      Example 3:
      Input: 1 / 1How do different marketing strategies affect customer engagement for a retail business?
      Output: Content marketing increases organic engagement through informative and valuable content. Social media marketing fosters direct interaction and community building. Email marketing delivers personalized messages directly to customers. Each strategy has unique strengths and weaknesses, and the best approach depends on the business's goals and target audience.

original_prompt:
I want you to answer as a mathematics professor. I will ask you questions and you will answer with as many paragraphs as you need to provide a correct answer. Each paragraph will be one of these three types:

1. A thinking paragraph will start with "Thinking: " and here you will perform reasoning with the intent of helping you to determine an answer to the question.

2. A verifying paragraph will start with "Verifying: ". The purpose of a verifying sentence is to critique the previous sentence and in particular to uncover any wrong statements in the previous sentence.

3. The final paragraph will start with "Answer: " and here you will provide the answer to the question in a succinct way.

You will not simply assume that what you are saying is true, you will use verifying paragraphs to make sure. Here are two examples:

Question: What is the prime factorization of 8?

Thinking: I know that 8 = 4 * 2 and 4 and 2 are primes.

Verifying: No, 4 is not a prime because 4 = 2 * 2.

Thinking: OK, then 8 = 2 * 2 * 2 and 2 is a prime.

Answer: 2 is a prime because it has no smaller factors. Also 2 * 2 * 2 = 8 because 2 * 2 = 4 and (2 * 2) * 2 = 4 * 2 = 8. So that is correct.

Answer: The prime factorization of 8 is 2 * 2 * 2.

Question: What is the square of the area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7?

Thinking: The area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7 is 3 * 7 = 21.

Verifying: It is true that 3 * 7 = 21 because 7 + 7 + 7 = 14 + 7 = 21. Good.

Thinking: The square of the area of the rectangle is then 21 squared, which is 2112.

Verifying: 21 squared is 21 * 21. Both sides of the multiplication are odd, so the product is odd. 2112 is even. So 2112 cannot be the square of 21.

Thinking: OK, let's do it more carefully then. 21 * 21 = (20 + 1) * (20 + 1) = 400 + 1*20 + 1*20 + 1 = 400 + 40 + 1 = 441.

Verifying: That is correct.

Answer: The answer is 441.

fine_tuned_response:
Here are two example prompts:

Thinking: I know that 8 = 4 * 2 and 4 and 2 are primes.

Verifying: No, 4 is not a prime because 4 = 2 * 2.

Thinking: OK, then 8 = 2 * 2 * 2 and 2 is a prime.

Answer: 2 is a prime because it has no smaller factors. Also 2 * 2 * 2 = 8 because 2 * 2 = 4 and (2 * 2) * 2 = 4 * 2 = 8. So that is correct.

Thinking: The area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7 is 3 * 7 = 21.

Verifying: It is true that 3 * 7 = 21 because 7 + 7 + 7 = 14 + 7 = 21. Good.

Thinking: The square of the area of the rectangle is then 21 squared, which is 2112.

Verifying: 21 squared is 21 * 21. Both sides of the multiplication are odd, so the product is odd. 2112 is even. So 2112 cannot be the square of 21.

Thinking: OK, let's do it more carefully then. 21 * 21 = (20 + 1) * (20 + 1) = 400 + 1*20 + 1*20 + 1 = 400 + 40 + 1 = 441.

Verifying: That is correct.

Answer: The answer is 441.

Question: Explain the process of long division.

Thinking: Long division is a way to divide a larger number by a smaller number to find the quotient and remainder.

Verifying: Yes, that is the general concept. Now, let's break down the steps.

Thinking: First, write the dividend inside the division symbol and the divisor outside. Then, determine how many times the divisor goes into the first digit or digits of the dividend. Write this number (the quotient) above the dividend.

Verifying: Okay, now multiply the quotient by the divisor and write the product below the digits of the dividend that you used.

Thinking: Subtract the product from the digits of the dividend you used. Bring down the next digit of the dividend.

Verifying: Repeat the process of dividing, multiplying, and subtracting until there are no more digits to bring down.

Answer: The final number remaining after all the subtractions is the remainder. The number written above the dividend is the quotient.

Now, explain the process of polynomial long division step-by-step, including how to handle remainders.

original_prompt: Hi, I would like you to help me to implement a system call in RedHat linux 2.6.9. I already have adequate knowledge of kernel programming.
instruction: Hi, I would like you to help me to implement a system call in RedHat linux 2.6.9. I already have adequate knowledge of kernel programming.
fine_tuned_response:
You are an expert system call implementation engineer specializing in RedHat Linux 2.6.9. Your task is to help a user implement a new system call, `my_syscall`, within the kernel. Provide a step-by-step guide, including code snippets, for the following:

1.  **Defining the System Call Number:** Choose a unique system call number that is not already in use. Document your choice.
2.  **Implementing the System Call Handler Function:**
    *   Write the C code for the `my_syscall` handler function. This function should take two integer arguments, `arg1` and `arg2`, and return an integer value.
    *   Include necessary error handling (e.g., checking argument validity).
    *   Provide comments to explain the code.
3.  **Modifying the System Call Table:**
    *   Locate the system call table in the kernel source code. (Specifically, find the relevant file and line number.)
    *   Add an entry for `my_syscall` in the system call table, mapping the chosen number to the handler function you wrote in step 2.
4.  **Implementing User-Space Interface:**
    *   Write a C function that can be used by user-space applications to call `my_syscall`. This function should use the `syscall` function (or equivalent) to make the system call.
    *   Include a header file declaration for the user-space function.
5.  **Testing the System Call:**
    *   Write a simple user-space program that calls `my_syscall` and prints the result.
    *   Compile and run the program. Verify that the output is correct and that there are no errors.
6.  **Cleanup:**
    *   Provide instructions on how to remove the system call from the kernel and the user-space code.

Include code snippets for each step, along with explanations. Structure your response in a clear and organized manner, making it easy to follow.

original_prompt: 1 / 1Is it possible to run Citrix Optimizer via commandline or script on persistent machiens that are already built?
instruction: 1 / 1Is it possible to run Citrix Optimizer via commandline or script on persistent machiens that are already built?
fine_tuned_response:
You are an expert Citrix administrator. I need to deploy Citrix Optimizer to a large number of persistent virtual machines running Windows Server 2019. I want to automate the process using a script or command-line tool. 

Here's an example of how I want the script to function:
1. Check if Citrix Optimizer is already installed. If so, remove it.
2. Download the latest Citrix Optimizer MSI installer from the Citrix website.

4. Run Citrix Optimizer with the 'recommended' configuration.
5. Check for any errors during the installation and optimization process.
6. Log the results, including any errors, to a file.

Now, provide me with the script (in PowerShell or batch) that accomplishes these steps. Make sure the script includes detailed comments explaining each step. Also, specify the necessary command-line parameters for the silent installation and optimization. Explain how to handle potential errors and log the results effectively. Consider using a function for the main logic to make the script reusable and easier to understand.

original_prompt: Hi GPT, I want to develop an App where multiple users (usually friends) shares their expenses and pictures of individual trips that they make all together. instruction: Hi GPT, I want to develop an App where multiple users (usually friends) shares their expenses and pictures of individual trips that they make all together. In here, they use different platforms to upload their pictures (iCloud and Google Photos mostly). Could you write cucumber scenarios for such app?
fine_tuned_response: You are an experienced software testing consultant specializing in mobile application development. Your task is to create comprehensive Cucumber scenarios for an expense-sharing app. This app allows multiple users to upload expenses, associate them with specific trips, and share pictures from iCloud and Google Photos. The app should handle the following functionalities: user registration, trip creation, expense logging, photo uploading from iCloud and Google Photos, and expense report generation. Provide scenarios for each of these features, ensuring they cover both successful and error-handling paths. Structure the scenarios clearly, using the Given-When-Then format. Ensure the scenarios are specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART). Include relevant tags for each scenario (e.g., @user_registration, @trip_creation, @expense_logging, @photo_upload, @report_generation).

original_prompt: please write a script to see if a distribution of settlment sizes follows zipfs law. the code should be written in R.
instruction: please write a script to see if a distribution of settlment sizes follows zipfs law. the code should be written in R.
fine_tuned_response:
I want you to analyze a dataset of settlement sizes to determine if it follows Zipf's Law. First, explain what Zipf's Law states in the context of settlement sizes. Then, provide R code to perform the following steps:

1.  Load the settlement size data into R (assume the data is in a file named "settlement_data.csv", with a column named "population" containing the settlement sizes).
2.  Rank the settlements by population size in descending order.
3.  Create a scatter plot with rank on the x-axis and log(population) on the y-axis.
4.  Calculate the slope of a line fitted to the scatter plot using linear regression.
5.  Report the calculated slope and its confidence interval.

Finally, interpret the calculated slope in relation to Zipf's Law. A slope close to -1 suggests the data follows Zipf's Law. Include comments in the code to explain each step. Also, include a brief explanation of any assumptions made in the code.

original_prompt:
Hi ChatGPT, please write me an application/statement. I will provide you with the information needed to so. The writing style should be formal but enthusiastic. The text should be coherent and the points be presented in a logical manner. Overall it should not exceed max 500 words.
The statement should introduce me, Kiarash Tebbi, a 25 year old master’s student of “Biological Sciences” of the “University of Cologne”. I am motivated to apply for this position “2023 International Student Project: Design a social media campaign and support the fight against climate change!” for two main reasons. One, because I consider myself an environmentalist. As a biology student, I have a love for the environment and understand the importance of the need to do more to protect it. In fact, during my BSc studies of biology, I volunteered at the “Environmental Club” of my university and ultimately became the deputy director of the club. Two, I understand the importance of using technology in our digital age, and plan to enrich my skills in this regard. In fact, this is the reason I’m using “ChatGPT” for this application and will use “Quillbot” to rephrase some of the sentences if needed, and finally I’ll be using “Grammarly” to proof-check the text. More specifically on social media, my number one resource for finding academic papers, comes from following “Twitter” accounts of famous scientists of my field. So, I totally grasp the importance of social media in communicating with a broader audience. Furthermore, I plan to become a hard-core scientist, but I’m interested in scientific advocacy or even environmental advocacy and social media skills can help me with all of my potential career goals.
The statement should also state what I can bring to the group. As a biology student, I have good knowledge of ecology and the living world in general. We should know what we want to protect right? I do have some previous experience with international courses. I’ve participated in two courses about biology of aging. One, the “Cologne’s Summer School of Aging” organized by the CECAD, and another “Aging, Medicine and Society – Understanding, Shaping, Managing Longevity” organized by the University of Cologne and the University of Keio. original_prompt: Write a node.js script that can be called as a npm script, reads a .csv file of emails and inserts the values into a mongo database collection "trialDurations". The script will use dot-env to find the mongo address.
instruction: Write a node.js script that can be called as a npm script, reads a .csv file of emails and inserts the values into a mongo database collection "trialDurations". The script will use dot-env to find the mongo address.
fine_tuned_response:
Let's create a Node.js script for importing email addresses from a CSV file into a MongoDB collection. Here's how we'll approach this:

1.  **Project Setup:**
    *   Initialize a Node.js project (e.g., `npm init -y`).
    *   Install the necessary packages: `npm install mongodb csv-parser dotenv`.
    *   Create a `.env` file in the project root with the following variables:
        *   `MONGO_URI`: The connection string to your MongoDB instance (e.g., `mongodb://localhost:27017/myDatabase`).
        *   `CSV_FILE_PATH`: The path to your CSV file (e.g., `./emails.csv`).
        *   `DATABASE_NAME`: The name of your database (e.g., `myDatabase`).
        *   `COLLECTION_NAME`: The name of the collection to insert the data into (e.g., `trialDurations`).

2.  **Code Structure:**
    *   Create a file named `import-emails.js`.
    *   Import the necessary modules: `mongodb`, `csv-parser`, `dotenv`.
    *   Load the environment variables from `.env`.
    *   Connect to the MongoDB database.
    *   Read the CSV file using `csv-parser`.
    *   For each row in the CSV:
        *   Create a document object to be inserted into the database.
        *   Insert the document into the specified collection.
    *   Handle errors and close the database connection.

3.  **CSV File Format:**
    *   The CSV file should have a header row.
    *   Each row should contain at least one column representing the email address.  We'll assume the first column is the email address.

4.  **Error Handling:**
    *   Implement error handling for:
        *   Connecting to the database.
        *   Reading the CSV file.
        *   Inserting documents into the database.

5.  **Example Usage:**
    *   Create a sample `emails.csv` file with the following content:
        ```csv
        email
        email1@example.com
        email2@example.com
        email3@example.com
        ```
    *   Add a script to your `package.json` to run the script (e.g., `"start": "node import-emails.js"`).
    *   Run the script using `npm start`.

Here's a basic structure to get you started. Refine it based on the best practices for MongoDB, CSV parsing, and Node.js development. Please provide the complete, executable Node.js script.

original_prompt: give me a terraform module that will run several times using different service principals on a tfvars file, it will also run with a nested loop for_each for every branch I specify on a variable list, the module should deploy a federated identity on azure
instruction: give me a terraform module that will run several times using different service principals on a tfvars file, it will also run with a nested loop for_each for every branch I specify on a variable list, the module should deploy a federated identity on azure
fine_tuned_response:
Here's an example of a Terraform module that uses variables and for_each to deploy multiple resource groups in Azure:

```terraform
resource "azurerm_resource_group" "example" {
  for_each = var.resource_group_names

  name     = each.value
  location = var.location
}

variable "resource_group_names" {
  type        = list(string)
  description = "The names of the resource groups to create."
  default     = ["rg-dev-eastus", "rg-prod-westus2"]
}

variable "location" {
  type        = string
  description = "The location to deploy the resource groups to."
  default     = "eastus"
}
```

Now, create a Terraform module that deploys federated identities for multiple service principals. The module should:

1.  Accept a list of service principal object IDs as input.
2.  Accept a map of 'branch' names to 'branch_path' strings as input.
3.  Iterate through the list of service principal object IDs.
4.  For each service principal, iterate through the 'branch' map.
5.  Create an `azurerm_federated_identity_credential` resource for each service principal and branch combination. The name of the federated identity credential should be in the format `sp-{service_principal_id}-{branch_name}`.
6.  The `display_name` of the federated identity credential should be `Service Principal: {service_principal_id} - Branch: {branch_name}`.
7.  The `audiences` of the federated identity credential should be `['api://azuread_application_id']` (replace `azuread_application_id` with the actual ID).
8.  The `subject` of the federated identity credential should be a combination of the branch path and the service principal ID, using the format `path/{branch_path};oid/{service_principal_id}`.

Here's an example of the input variables:

```terraform
variables {
  service_principal_ids = ["sp-id-1", "sp-id-2"]
  branches = {
    dev    = "path/dev"
    prod   = "path/prod"
  }
  azuread_application_id = "my-app-id"
}
```

Structure the module to be reusable and easily configurable. Include necessary variable definitions and output values. The final module should be well-formatted and easy to understand. Provide the complete Terraform module code.

original_prompt: 1 / 1Within the duration of one year, a rabbit population first multiplies itself by a factor a and on the last day of the year b rabbits are taken by humans for adoption. Supposing that on first day of the first year there are x rabbits, we know that exactly 3 years afterwards there will be a population of 27x − 26 rabbits. What are the values of a and b?
instruction: 1 / 1Within the duration of one year, a rabbit population first multiplies itself by a factor a and on the last day of the year b rabbits are taken by humans for adoption. Supposing that on first day of the first year there are x rabbits, we know that exactly 3 years afterwards there will be a population of 27x − 26 rabbits. What are the values of a and b?
fine_tuned_response:
Let's think step by step.

First, analyze the given information about the rabbit population. We know that the population multiplies by 'a' each year, and 'b' rabbits are adopted at the end of each year. We also know the initial population (x) and the population after 3 years (27x - 26).

Second, write equations to represent the rabbit population at the end of each year.
- Year 1: ax - b
- Year 2: a(ax - b) - b = a^2x - ab - b
- Year 3: a(a^2x - ab - b) - b = a^3x - a^2b - ab - b

Third, equate the expression for the population at the end of Year 3 to the given value (27x - 26).
a^3x - a^2b - ab - b = 27x - 26

Fourth, notice that the equation should hold true for any initial population 'x'. Therefore, compare the coefficients of 'x' on both sides:
a^3 = 27  =>  a = 3

Fifth, substitute a = 3 back into the equation:
27x - 9b - 3b - b = 27x - 26
-13b = -26
b = 2

Therefore, the values of a and b are a = 3 and b = 2.

Now, evaluate the following Python expression:
```python
a = 3
b = 2
x = 5 # Example initial population
year_1 = a * x - b
year_2 = a * year_1 - b
year_3 = a * year_2 - b
expected_population = 27 * x - 26
print(f"Year 1 population: {year_1}")
print(f"Year 2 population: {year_2}")
print(f"Year 3 population: {year_3}")
print(f"Expected population: {expected_population}")
```

original_prompt: What happens in the brain when I'm doing a fist with my hand?
instruction: What happens in the brain when I'm doing a fist with my hand?
fine_tuned_response:
Here are a few examples to guide you:

Example 1:
Input: Describe the brain activity during a simple eye blink.
Output: When you blink, the superior colliculus, located in the midbrain, initiates the reflex. The frontal eye field and parietal cortex are also involved in planning and executing the blink. Sensory input from the retina travels to the brainstem and cerebral cortex to coordinate the movement.

Example 2:
Input: Explain how the brain processes visual information.
Output: Visual information enters through the retina and is processed by the visual cortex in the occipital lobe. From there, it travels to other areas like the temporal lobe for object recognition and the parietal lobe for spatial awareness. Different pathways handle different aspects of vision, such as color, motion, and form.

Now, analyze the following input and provide a detailed explanation of the brain activity:

Input: Describe the brain activity when a person makes a fist.

original_prompt:
A software engineer has to complete five projects in this current financial year, where the time taken
for completing project 1 is 10 days, project 2 is 1 day, project 3 is 2 days, project 4 is one day and
project 5 is 5 days.
a. Find the waiting time for each of the project if the software engineer follows the sequence of
completing the project as 2, 3,4,1,5
b. Find the waiting time for each of the project, if he chooses project based on minimal time to
complete. Provided with the necessary condition is that no software engineer is allowed to
continue with a same project more than 3 days.
Create a table for both scenario
context:
a. Find the waiting time for each of the project if the software engineer follows the sequence of
completing the project as 2, 3,4,1,5
b. Find the waiting time for each of the project, if he chooses project based on minimal time to
complete. Provided with the necessary condition is that no software engineer is allowed to
continue with a same project more than 3 days.
instruction:
A software engineer has to complete five projects in this current financial year, where the time taken
for completing project 1 is 10 days, project 2 is 1 day, project 3 is 2 days, project 4 is one day and
project 5 is 5 days.

Create a table for both scenario
fine_tuned_response:
You are an experienced operations manager. Your task is to analyze a software engineer's project schedule and calculate waiting times under different scheduling scenarios. 

Here's the situation: A software engineer needs to complete five projects in the current financial year. The estimated time to complete each project is as follows:

Project 1: 10 days
Project 2: 1 day
Project 3: 2 days
Project 4: 1 day
Project 5: 5 days

For each of the following scenarios, calculate the waiting time for each project and present the results in a clear table:

Scenario 1: The software engineer completes the projects in the following sequence: Project 2, Project 3, Project 4, Project 1, Project 5.

Scenario 2: The software engineer prioritizes projects based on the shortest duration first. However, the software engineer cannot work on the same project for more than 3 days consecutively. If a project requires more than 3 days, it must be paused, and another project started.

The table should include the project number, start time, end time, and waiting time for each project in each scenario.

original_prompt:
hello!. can you please help me write a cover letter for a potential dream job as a Senior Motion Designer at Dash studio? Below is some information about the company, job role, requirements etc… 

Description about the company:
Dash is a high-end animation and motion design studio built around the power of creativity and community. We believe the best work happens together, as a team. It’s why successful employees at dash are more than just creatives, they’re supporters and mentors. We help push one another to get better, we lift up the motion design community as a whole, and we’re always willing to help each other. Dash makes great content, but most importantly, we do it with wonderful people.

Job summary: Senior Motion Designers are leaders in the motion graphics, animation, and editing space. They are the go-to problem solvers for the studio and push our ideation, conceptualization, and creation capabilities. Not only do Senior Motion Designers make some of the best work for the studio, but they also represent some of the best in the industry. They mentor younger staff and  push new techniques, innovations, and expectations for the future.

Requirements: 
- Education & Experience: A portfolio highlighting versatility in animation built on a foundation of design principles with at least 3 years of professional experience in a studio or agency environment. 
- Animation & Design Fundamentals: Motion designers should know the design basics (line, form, shape, value, texture, and color) as well as the twelve principles of animation.
- Adobe Programs: It’s a necessity for dash Motion Designers to have a strong understanding of Adobe After Effects and proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and Premiere. 
- Conceptualization: From highly technical subjects to abstract ideas, Motion Designers should feel comfortable brainstorming multiple approaches to animating various frames.
- Organization: To successfully hop between projects, Motion Designers will be required to follow and maintain organized project files based on dash naming conventions and structural requirements. 
- Communication & Time Management: Strong communication skills to communicate with producers, directors, and team members throughout projects with willingness to mentor other creatives.

Essential functions:
* Leads the studio in creative originality finding new and unique ways to build and animate compositions.  
* Exceeds expectations and consistently goes above-and-beyond with creative exploration, execution, and innovation on project assignments.
* Expert on project workflows; providing guidance and technical support on various creative projects across departments.
* Assist in finding, interviewing, evaluating, onboarding and mentoring new animators.
* Assists Art Directors in assigning animators to different sections of a video with the ability to direct post-production on projects if necessary.
* Assists Art Directors in compositing efforts combining team project files and assets; prepping for delivery.
* Individual is a multi-talented animator that confidently works in a variety of styles with different design and motion techniques with the ability to jump between projects quickly and efficiently.
* Able to problem solve most technical animation challenges and can offer help to peers.
* Leads the studio on quick and efficient work. 
* Strong organizational, time management and communication skills, both written and verbal to efficiently respond to feedback from directors and producers.

It’s why successful employees at dash are more than just creatives, they’re supporters and mentors. We help push one another to get better, we lift up the motion design community as a whole, and we’re always willing to help each other. Dash makes great content, but most importantly, we do it with wonderful people.

Job summary: Senior Motion Designers are leaders in the motion graphics, animation, and editing space. They are the go-to problem solvers for the studio and push our ideation, conceptualization, and creation capabilities. Not only do Senior Motion Designers make some of the best work for the studio, but they also represent some of the best in the industry. They mentor younger staff and  push new techniques, innovations, and expectations for the future.

Requirements: 
- Education & Experience: A portfolio highlighting versatility in animation built on a foundation of design principles with at least 3 years of professional experience in a studio or agency environment. 
- Animation & Design Fundamentals: Motion designers should know the design basics (line, form, shape, value, texture, and color) as well as the twelve principles of animation.
- Adobe Programs: It’s a necessity for dash Motion Designers to have a strong understanding of Adobe After Effects and proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and Premiere. 
- Conceptualization: From highly technical subjects to abstract ideas, Motion Designers should feel comfortable brainstorming multiple approaches to animating various frames.
- Organization: To successfully hop between projects, Motion Designers will be required to follow and maintain organized project files based on dash naming conventions and structural requirements. 
- Communication & Time Management: Strong communication skills to communicate with producers, directors, and team members throughout projects with willingness to mentor other creatives.

Essential functions:
* Leads the studio in creative originality finding new and unique ways to build and animate compositions.

* Leads the studio on quick and efficient work.

original_prompt: Create a good improv comedy script on crypto
instruction: Create a good improv comedy script on crypto
fine_tuned_response:
You are an expert comedy writer specializing in improv scripts. Your task is to rewrite the following improv comedy prompt to be more specific, detailed, and effective in eliciting a strong comedic performance:

Original Prompt: Create an improv comedy script on crypto

Revised Prompt: You are a seasoned improv comedian renowned for your sharp wit and ability to weave humor into complex topics. Your goal is to craft an improv comedy script centered around the theme of cryptocurrency. The script should feature three distinct scenes:

    Scene 1: A high-stakes meeting between a seasoned Bitcoin miner and a clueless tech investor. The miner tries to explain the intricacies of blockchain technology, while the investor only understands memes and get-rich-quick schemes.
    Scene 2: A humorous debate between a seasoned cryptocurrency trader and a skeptical financial advisor. The trader attempts to convince the advisor to invest in various altcoins, employing a combination of technical jargon and outlandish claims.
    Scene 3: A chaotic auction where ridiculous items related to cryptocurrency are being sold. These items include physical Bitcoin wallets made of gold, limited edition NFTs of cartoon apes, and a used mining rig that promises to generate massive returns.

Each scene should have a clear setup, rising action, and comedic climax. The script should be approximately 5 pages in length, with each scene taking roughly 1.5 pages. Use character development to create memorable personalities and enhance the comedic timing. Focus on generating original and creative jokes, avoiding clichés and relying on sharp observations of human behavior. The tone should be satirical and self-aware, poking fun at the hype and speculation surrounding cryptocurrency. Ensure the script includes stage directions and sufficient context for the performers.

original_prompt:
Please read the job advert for "Data Analyst" at BBC Studios below and say "OK".

Job Introduction

BBC Studios’ Data and Insights team is looking for a Data Analyst to join a growing department and deliver reporting and insights on the BBC’s iconic content. Working with data from various sources including BARB TV ratings, streaming data and other SVOD and industry sources, you will turn data into actionable information for the business. The role will work alongside a team of data specialists and support colleagues in research and insight. If you love TV and are confident working with numbers this is the role for you!

BBC Studios is the commercial arm of the BBC. It is a creative powerhouse for the development, production and distribution of content with offices in over 20 global markets. Its activities span content financing, development, production, sales and direct-to-consumer services. With a turnover of around £1.4 billion, we are responsible for household names that include Strictly Come Dancing, Dragons’ Den and Frozen Planet and run BBC.com and BBC Studios’ direct-to-consumer properties.

Role Responsibility

Turning raw data into impactful and easy to understand reports and visualisations.
Streamlining existing reports and the way they are produced.
Supporting colleagues in Insights to deliver information to their stakeholders.

Are you the right candidate?

You will be skilled in the use of Excel and Powerpoint.
Numerate and confident in communicating numbers to others.
The role will work heavily with industry currencies such as BARB data so experience using reporting systems (e.g TechEdge) to extract data would be beneficial.
Experience using SQL or other coding languages an advantage but not essential.
The role is suitable for someone with experience in a reporting role, or in a business with a focus on numbers.
You will have an interest in TV/VOD content and the industry as a whole.

Package Description

Band: C

Contract Type: Perm/ Full time

Location: London TVC

Working Pattern: Hybrid Working (Home-based plus two/three days a week in the office)

We are really proud to share that we are a Level 2 Disability Confident Employer and so if you require any reasonable adjustments in order to apply please do contact us at resourcing@bbc.co.uk with the job reference in the subject. We advertise all our roles on Evenbreak, the specialist job board for disabled candidates

Flexible/agile working -opportunities across the business. We’re happy to discuss a formal flexible working pattern. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application. There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at the offer stage.
Excellent career progression – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certifications.
Benefits - We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (plus an additional day which is a Corporation Day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.

About The BBC

The BBC is committed to building a culturally diverse workforce and therefore strongly encourages applications from under represented groups. We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of their background. We strive to be the best British content company in the world, attracting the best creative talents in the business, so that we can bring premium quality award-winning programmes, content and brands to the viewer no matter where they are.

The BBC Group has set out the first in a new series of bold steps to transform our programming and better represent the public we serve.We have the biggest financial investment to on-air inclusion in the industry, together with our existing commissioning budget, we are committed to throwing open our doors more widely than ever to diverse stories and diverse storytellers. Together with a diverse workforce we will accelerate the pace of change in increasing diversity and inclusion both on and off air

To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please visit our website.

Attached documents

Our BBC Values

original_prompt: please create a python script that finds archives all files in a directory and its subfiles to a tgz file
instruction: please create a python script that finds archives all files in a directory and its subfiles to a tgz file
fine_tuned_response:
Here's an example of a Python script that archives a directory:

```python
import tarfile
import os

def archive_directory(directory, archive_name):
    with tarfile.open(archive_name, "w:gz") as tar:
        for root, _, files in os.walk(directory):
            for file in files:
                file_path = os.path.join(root, file)
                tar.add(file_path, arcname=file_path)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    directory_to_archive = "/path/to/your/directory"  # Replace with the actual directory
    archive_file_name = "my_archive.tgz"
    archive_directory(directory_to_archive, archive_file_name)
    print(f"Directory '{directory_to_archive}' archived to '{archive_file_name}'")
```

Now, write a Python script to archive all files within a given directory (including subdirectories) to a tgz file. The script should:

1.  Take the directory path as an argument.
2.  Create a tgz file with a user-specified name (default to "archive.tgz").
3.  Iterate through all files and subdirectories within the directory.
4.  Add each file to the tgz archive.
5.  Handle potential errors gracefully (e.g., file not found).
6.  Provide informative output to the console, indicating the archive name and success or failure.
7.  Use the `tarfile` module for creating the archive.

Include comments in the script to explain each step. Also, add a main block to demonstrate how to use the script.

original_prompt:
Challenge description:
Increased bridging activity over the past year has led to multiple bridge solutions to accommodate users hopping across chains. While this introduced a slew of routes, it also added a layer of uncertainty around which one to pick. Bridge aggregators curate this for you and take the extra guesswork out of the equation. Instead of having to find multiple bridges, you can just use bridge aggregators to source the best route depending on where you want to go and what you want to bring with you.

Using the various bridge SDKs and protocols, write a bridge aggregator for the different bridges that work with Algorand. The submission should provide a unified UI or SDK where the user specifies where they are starting and where they want to go and then handle the transaction for the user. Right now, the primary bridges with Algorand support are

Glitter: https://portal.glitterfinance.org/developer-tools

Wormhole: https://book.wormhole.com/technical/algorand/overview.html

The submission should be written in a way that would support other bridges as they get released.

Submission Requirements
A valid submission will include the source code via a Github repository linked to your Gitcoin submission, a recorded demo and an article that explains how the application works. It is expected that most bounty challenges will be won by fully functioning submissions, however, in certain cases, where there is a higher degree of difficulty, projects and payouts will be assessed on progress made. The project submission deadline is 17:00 EST on February 8, 2023.

Judging Criteria
Four judges from The Algorand Foundation will also assess each project submission by February 19, 2023. The following criteria will be used to assess projects: IMPACT & USEFULNESS: How impactful and useful the submission is in the Algorand ecosystem as a whole ORIGINALITY, CREATIVITY & INNOVATION: How new and novel the submission is versus existing technologies MASS USABILITY: How feasible is the idea & how adaptable is it across other integrations TECHNICAL DIFFICULTY: What is the level of skill or knowledge required to build the submission CLARITY: How clear or easily understood the documentation, examples and pitch video is TEAM DIVERSITY: How diverse are the team’s skill sets & what is the quality of the team formation

Winner Announcement Date
Winners will be announced on February 25, 2023, with payouts to be completed no more than one week thereafter.

Resources
Developer.algorand.org https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-started/dapps/ https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/asa/ https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/atc/ https://developer.algorand.org/docs/get-details/dapps/smart-contracts/ https://github.com/algorand-devrel Algorand Discord - https://discord.gg/Algorand

1.  What are the specific ways these substances improve a pitcher's performance (e.g., better grip, increased velocity, different spin)? Explain each effect.

original_prompt: Write a Java algorithm which, given a Map<String, RangeSet<Integer>> called wordToTimeRangesMap, outputs a List<Pair<Range<Integer>, Set<String>>> called snapshotList. Each snapshot in snapshotList should contain all of the strings from wordToTimeRangesMap for its timeRange (Range<Integer>). The List should be sorted by timeRange.
instruction: Write a Java algorithm which, given a Map<String, RangeSet<Integer>> called wordToTimeRangesMap, outputs a List<Pair<Range<Integer>, Set<String>>> called snapshotList. Each snapshot in snapshotList should contain all of the strings from wordToTimeRangesMap for its timeRange (Range<Integer>). The List should be sorted by timeRange.
fine_tuned_response:
I need a Java algorithm that processes a Map<String, RangeSet<Integer>> called wordToTimeRangesMap. The map's keys are strings (words), and its values are RangeSet<Integer> objects representing the time ranges the word appears in. The algorithm should produce a List<Pair<Range<Integer>, Set<String>>> called snapshotList. Each pair in the list should represent a snapshot of all the words present within a specific time range. The time ranges in snapshotList should be contiguous and cover the entire time span represented in wordToTimeRangesMap. The list should be sorted by the start time of each time range. For example:

wordToTimeRangesMap = {
    "hello": [1, 3), [5, 7)],
    "world": [2, 4), [6, 8)]
}

snapshotList = [
    ([1, 2), {"hello"}),
    ([2, 3), {"hello", "world"}),
    ([3, 4), {"world"}),
    ([5, 6), {"hello"}),
    ([6, 7), {"hello", "world"}),
    ([7, 8), {"world"})
]

Write the Java code for this algorithm, ensuring it is efficient and handles edge cases correctly. Include comments to explain the logic.

instruction:
I have the following script:



--I want to execute this on every file inside /var/www on CentOS, how do I do that?
fine_tuned_response:
I have a script that checks for and removes a specific line from an HTML file:

```bash
#!/bin/bash
filename=$1

# Check if the specific text exists in the file
if grep -q "z-10 fixed bottom-5 inset-x-0 mx-auto max-w-fit rounded-lg px-3 py-2 bg-white border border-gray-100 shadow-md flex justify-between space-x-2 items-center" "$filename"; then

# Remove the line with the specific text if it exists
sudo sed -i '/z-10 fixed bottom-5 inset-x-0 mx-auto max-w-fit rounded-lg px-3 py-2 bg-white border border-gray-100 shadow-md flex justify-between space-x-2 items-center/d' "$filename"
fi
```

I want to execute this script on ALL HTML files within the /var/www directory on a CentOS system. Here's how to run it on a single file (replace filename.html with the actual filename):

```bash
./script_name.sh filename.html
```

Now, provide a complete, step-by-step shell script (including error handling) that iterates through all .html files in /var/www, executes the provided script on each file, and logs any errors encountered. Ensure the script handles cases where a file doesn't exist or the user lacks necessary permissions. Structure the script for easy readability and maintenance.
